remarks:
If ` x ` is not free in ` ph ` , ` ps ` , and ` ch ` , it is not free in ` ( ph /\ ps /\ ch ) ` .  (Contributed by NM, 14-Sep-2003.)  (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 2-Jan-2018.) 

---

 If ` x ` is not free in ` ph ` , ` ps ` , and ` ch ` , it is not free in ` ( ph /\ ps /\ ch ) ` .  (Contributed by NM, 14-Sep-2003.)
statement:
hb.1 $e |- ( ph -> A. x ph ) $.
hb.2 $e |- ( ps -> A. x ps ) $.
hb.3 $e |- ( ch -> A. x ch ) $.
hb3an $p |- ( ( ph /\ ps /\ ch ) -> A. x ( ph /\ ps /\ ch ) ) $.
